title: Tortula acaulon
text: Tortula acaulon, formerly " Phascum cuspidatum", the cuspidate earth-moss or toothed phascum moss, is a <a href="moss">moss</a> with 3 mm leaves which forms green patches. It is very common and has a number of varieties in a wide range of habitats. The variety "piliferum" occurs on sandy soils near the sea.
